dataList.title: Los Mariachis
dataList.content: Uh… Who might you all be…?

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: I see that you've made some new friends in the meantime, Rodya.
Sonya laid his hand of cards open on the table.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: You win, Rodion. I have no objections.
He then walked out the door and didn’t return.
Once he disappeared, a sudden, deafeningly hollow clap filled the room.

dataList.title: Los Mariachis
dataList.content: Haha, caramba… Thanks for the spectacular game, but…

dataList.title: Los Mariachis
dataList.content: ... I’m not as cool as Sonya.

dataList.title: Los Mariachis
dataList.content: Since you brought your friends, why don’t I introduce some of mine as well?
…Y’know, uh, I’m pretty sure I heard one of your guys say that gambling is an activity done purely for fun or something.

dataList.title: Los Mariachis
dataList.content: Mhm, exactly. Isn't this more fun than caving right away?
You were gonna force your way downstairs regardless of who won the game, weren’t you?

dataList.title: Los Mariachis
dataList.content: Pfh. Think about it. Why would I give up on the Golden Bough ‘cause a round or three of some game said so, when I have the strength and the manpower to seize it?
Aight, then. I’m actually glad you’re a rebel.
I was starting to get bored with all this sitting around and chatting.
